intro: Ranunculus neapolitanus f. brevirostris, commonly known as the Naples buttercup, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive, short beak-like spur. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 cm, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, blooming in early to mid-summer. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
